p:
Although an interruption in ART drug supply would have by far the largest impact of any potential disruption, effects of lower quality clinical care due to overstretched health facilities, interruption of supply of other drugs (eg, co-trimoxazole, which is taken to prevent protozoal, bacterial, and fungal infections), and suspension of HIV testing, or due to reluctance among patients to access care because of concerns about exposure to severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2
19 would all have substantial population-level effects. Interruption to condom supplies, PrEP, and peer education would make populations more susceptible to increases in HIV incidence, although physical distancing measures could lead to reductions in risky sexual behaviour.
